turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm calling about claim number 789012345. I filed it three days ago for water damage, and the status online still just says 'submitted'. Is anything actually happening? I need to get this fixed ASAP!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you for contacting us regarding claim 789012345. I see that your claim was successfully submitted. It is currently in the initial review queue. We will assign an adjuster to your case shortly. Processing times can vary.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, 'shortly' isn't very helpful. What does 'initial review queue' even mean? I uploaded photos and everything they asked for right away. My living room ceiling is literally collapsing! How long until someone *actually* looks at it and contacts me? Is there a target SLA for assignment or review for this type of claim, or does it just sit there indefinitely?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration and the urgency of your situation. For water damage claims with initial documentation provided, our typical internal target for assigning an adjuster is 2-3 business days from submission. While processing times aren't guaranteed SLAs, your claim was submitted three business days ago, so it should be assigned very soon, likely within the next business day. Once assigned, the adjuster will contact you directly to arrange an inspection and discuss next steps. I apologize for the vague response earlier; we are working to get an adjuster assigned promptly.
